summary: Charles W. Sandman is identified as the Chief of the Contract Personnel Division. A memorandum from Sandman to the Office of Finance advises of the termination of consultant agreements effective June 30, 1974, with exceptions noted. Other documents in the collection pertain to personnel records and contract amendments, but Sandman's direct involvement is limited to the termination memorandum.
significance: Charles W. Sandman's significance in the JFK context, based on the provided documents, appears to be related to his role in managing contract personnel within an organization, specifically overseeing the termination of consultant agreements. The documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, but rather to administrative functions within the Contract Personnel Division.
